RE: License#: CB330314400
Dear Mr. DeSantis:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 2/1/2024 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
(3) An agency shall provide the licensee an application
for renewal of the license and document the action not
less than 60 calendar days before the expiration date
of the license. A renewal application must be provided
to a licensee, regardless of any pending
recommendation for disciplinary action of the license.
One of six foster home files had documentation that an application for a renewal
was not provided at least 60 days prior to expiration.
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and make
a licensing recommendation to the department at least
15 calendar days before the expiration date of the
foster home license.
One of six foster home files did not complete a renewal evaluation at least 15
days prior to expiration.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
include all the following:

(d) Current immunizations for each child as required by
section 5111 of the public health code, 1978 PA 368,
MCL 333.5111. All the following apply:
(iii) If documentation of immunization or a copy of the
waiver is unavailable, then immunizations must begin
within 30 calendar days of placement.
One of six foster care files did not have current immunizations. The case was
accepted in October 2023 with overdue immunizations. The agency did not take
steps to begin immunizations within 30 days.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(2) An agency shall maintain a file documentation from
the medical or dental provider of all medical and dental
care received by a foster child.
One of six foster care files did not have documentation for the most recent
medical.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables:
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
One of six foster care files (One of nineteen service plans) did not have an FTM
completed within 30 days before the service plan due date.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Recent guidance was provided by the MDHHS contracts office regarding
medical passports. The guidance clarified that medical passports must be
updated and saved to MiSACWIS on a quarterly basis for all youth, including
permanent wards.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following area:
• The agency had a recent situation in which a borrowed bed agreement
changed to full agency responsibility over the weekend. The agency was
provided guidance regarding the effective date of the 3600 and how it would

impact borrowed bed paperwork. The agency was advised to document the
timeline in the case record to clarify the situation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
A CAP, approved 3/29/23, was the result of the 3/3/23 interim review. During that
review the agency had citaions regarding special evaluations, placement changes,
adoption orientation, adoption assessment timeliness, quarterly progress reports,
and providing copies of assessments to applicants. During this review period the
agency reported successful implementation of the CAP. This is evident as there
were no repeat violations found. The agency has shown improvement in all areas
of the prior CAP.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed on-site.
The CAA stated the 2023 CAP implementation included creation of templates,
review of processes, and timeliness reminders. These steps have improved all
areas that were previous violations. However, the CAA also noted some ongoing
staffing challenges, and systemic issues that are barriers to obtaining and
retaining staff. Although there are challenges with staffing, the agency continues to
have seasoned supervisors and dedicated staff.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported they enjoy their positions
and feel their agency is an excellent one to work for. Both staff indicated their
supervisors are knowledgeable, helpful, and supportive. Neither staff had any
concerns or suggestions for improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same building as the 2023 review. The
office has adequate locked storage for confidential information. There is sufficient
space to meet the needs of employees and staff.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
No safety concerns were identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
